required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: The George Washington University Biostatistics Center

clinical_study.source: The George Washington University Biostatistics Center

brief_summary.textblock: Non-inferiority randomized trial of 5,500 women with a cesarean delivery randomized prior to discharge to either an individualized opioid prescription protocol (IOPP) that includes shared decision making or to a fixed opioid prescription of 20 tablets of oxycodone 5mg.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a non-inferiority multi-center unblinded randomized trial of 5,500 women undergoing a cesarean delivery who are randomized before discharge to either an individualized opioid prescription protocol (IOPP) that includes shared decision making or to a fixed opioid prescription of 20 tablets of oxycodone 5mg. The primary endpoint is the presence/absence of moderate to severe pain at 1 week after discharge. Moderate to severe pain is defined as a value of 4 or higher on the Brief Pain Inventory worst pain scale (0 to 10) in the last 24 hours. Consenting women will be assigned in a 1:1 ratio to one of the two arms using a secure internet based randomization system maintained centrally by the Data Coordinating Center (DCC). Randomization will be stratified by site. Women will be followed through 90 days postpartum.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized to either an individualized opioid prescription protocol (IOPP) that includes shared decision making or to a fixed opioid prescription of 20 tablets of oxycodone 5mg.

primary_outcome.measure: Moderate to Severe Worst Pain Score at 1 week post discharge
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with moderate to severe pain at 1 week post-discharge; moderate to severe pain is defined as a value of 4 or higher on the Brief Pain Inventory worst pain in the last 24 hours numeric scale (from 0 to 10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Opioid prescription filled beyond that prescribed at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post discharge, 6 weeks postpartum, and 90 days postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with opioid prescription filled (beyond that prescribed at discharge) between one week post discharge and 1) two weeks post-discharge, 2) six weeks postpartum, and 3) ninety days postpartum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1week post discharge, 2 weeks post discharge, 6 weeks postpartum, 90 days postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of opioid prescriptions filled by one and two weeks post-discharge, and six weeks and ninety days postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of opioid tablets prescribed and unused
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week post discharge, 2 weeks post discharge, 6 weeks postpartum, 90 days postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Number of opioid tablets prescribed and unused from discharge to 1 week and 2 weeks post discharge, and 6 weeks and 90 days postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of morphine milligram equivalents used
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week post discharge, 2 weeks post discharge, 6 weeks postpartum, 90 days postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Total morphine milligram equivalents (MME) used from discharge to 1 week and 2 weeks post-discharge, and 6 weeks and 90 days postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain severity scores (worst, least, average, current)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks post discharge and 6 weeks postpartum and 90 days postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Pain severity scores (worst, least, average, current) in last 24 hours assessed on the Brief Pain Inventory numeric scale from 0 to 10 at 2 weeks post-discharge, and 6 weeks and 90 days postpartum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week post discharge, 2 weeks post discharge, 6 weeks postpartum, 90 days postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Pain interference scores in the last week assessed on the Brief Pain Inventory (numeric scale from 0 to 10) at 1 and 2 weeks post-discharge, and 6 weeks and 90 days postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Global impression of change in overall pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week post discharge, 2 weeks post discharge, 6 weeks postpartum, 90 days postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with global impression of change in overall pain (improved, no change, worse) at 1 and 2 weeks post-discharge, and 6 weeks and 90 days postpartum
Proportion of infants readmitted to the hospital

The proportion of participants with a score of 13 or higher on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale. The minimum score is 0 and the maximum score is 30. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes, where persons scoring about 13 are likely to be suffering from a depressive illness. The scale indicates how the respondent has felt during the previous week.

arm_group.description: Individualized opioid prescription protocol and shared decision making
fixed opioid prescription of 20 tablets of oxycodone 5mg

intervention.description: Individualized opioid prescription protocol (IOPP) that includes shared decision making

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Post cesarean delivery (combined vaginal/cesarean deliveries are not eligible)
- Singleton, twin or triplet gestation
Exclusion Criteria:
- An opioid prescription filled during the current pregnancy
- Known history of opioid use disorder, by medical record review
- Contraindication to opioids (oxycodone)
- Contraindications to both acetaminophen and ibuprofen
- Significant surgical procedures (e.g., hysterectomy) prior to randomization as pain trajectory will be completely different
- Fetal or neonatal death prior to randomization
- Inability to randomize within 1 day before planned discharge from the hospital
- Inability to participate in shared decision making as assessed by research staff
- Language barrier (non-English or Spanish speaking)
- Participation in this trial in a previous pregnancy
- Participation in another intervention study that influences the primary outcome in this trial

overall_official.affiliation: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania

patient_data.ipd_description: The dataset will be shared per NIH policy after the completion and publication of the main analyses.
